list_definition.definition: the amount (usually in a container) of some material needed to fill up some object which becomes empty through use

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I must go and buy some refills for my pen.

list_ex_of_english: We did see a quantity of old, small arm ammunition which was being refilled, but there was no evidence of any other intervention.
The pool has been emptied recently so that a leak could he repaired and it will be refilled and restocked with fish shortly.
The excavation was refilled but not resurfaced in order to allow the traffic to consolidate the foundation, as is the usual practice.
We know that it is extended to hair sprays and butane refills.
In any case apparently his post became vacant some years ago, and has not subsequently been refilled.
After refilling and restoration there is a colossal waste of money in going to that site to obtain another coal measure from it.
I am sure that we have all witnessed the spectacle of the same road being endlessly dug up and refilled by a succession of utility companies.
